unnormalised: AIIMS Delhi reported a surge in emergency cases last night, with 150+ patients rushed in following a major traffic accident on NH-8. Dr. Rajesh Kumar, head of Emergency Medicine, stated that a bus carrying pilgrims overturned near Gurgaon around 11:30 PM. "We’ve activated our mass casualty protocol," he said, "and all available staff, including nurses & paramedics, have been called in."
normalised: A-I-I-M-S Delhi reported a surge in emergency cases last night, with more than one hundred and fifty patients rushed in following a major traffic accident on N-H-eight. Doctor Rajesh Kumar, head of Emergency Medicine, stated that a bus carrying pilgrims overturned near Gurgaon around eleven thirty P-M. "We've activated our mass casualty protocol," he said, "and all available staff, including nurses and paramedics, have been called in."

unnormalised: Many patients presented with severe trauma, including head injuries, fractures, and internal bleeding. The hospital has been facing challenges in managing the influx of patients, particularly with limited bed availability in the ICU. “We are doing our best to triage and prioritize cases based on severity,” added Dr. Sharma. He mentioned that oxygen levels of many patients were dangerously low, some as low as 80%.
normalised: Many patients presented with severe trauma, including head injuries, fractures, and internal bleeding. The hospital has been facing challenges in managing the influx of patients, particularly with limited bed availability in the I-C-U. "We are doing our best to triage and prioritize cases based on severity," added Doctor Sharma. He mentioned that oxygen levels of many patients were dangerously low, some as low as eighty percent.

unnormalised: The Delhi Traffic Police are investigating the cause of the accident, suspecting over-speeding and poor visibility due to the dense fog. Ambulances from various hospitals, including Fortis & Max Healthcare, assisted in transporting the injured. Some patients required immediate surgery, and the hospital blood bank is appealing for O+ and B- blood donations.
normalised: The Delhi Traffic Police are investigating the cause of the accident, suspecting over-speeding and poor visibility due to the dense fog. Ambulances from various hospitals, including Fortis and Max Healthcare, assisted in transporting the injured. Some patients required immediate surgery, and the hospital blood bank is appealing for O positive and B negative blood donations.

unnormalised: "We've already performed 10+ critical surgeries," said Dr. Gupta, a senior surgeon at AIIMS. "The next 24 hrs are crucial for many of these patients." Relatives of the victims have started gathering at the hospital, anxiously awaiting updates on their loved ones. A help desk has been set up to provide information and support.
normalised: "We've already performed more than ten critical surgeries," said Doctor Gupta, a senior surgeon at A-I-I-M-S. "The next twenty four hours are crucial for many of these patients." Relatives of the victims have started gathering at the hospital, anxiously awaiting updates on their loved ones. A help desk has been set up to provide information and support.

unnormalised: The Health Minister has announced a compensation of Rs. 2 lakh for the families of the deceased and Rs. 50,000 for those injured. The PMO has also issued a statement expressing condolences and assuring full support to the affected families. Efforts are underway to identify all the victims and inform their families.
normalised: The Health Minister has announced a compensation of rupees two lakh for the families of the deceased and rupees fifty thousand for those injured. The P-M-O has also issued a statement expressing condolences and assuring full support to the affected families. Efforts are underway to identify all the victims and inform their families.

unnormalised: According to initial reports, 15 people have died in the accident, and over 40 are critically injured. The situation remains tense as medical staff work tirelessly to save lives. Citizens are requested to drive cautiously, especially during night hours and in foggy conditions. Several Good Samaritans helped in the rescue operation before the ambulances arrived.
normalised: According to initial reports, fifteen people have died in the accident, and over forty are critically injured. The situation remains tense as medical staff work tirelessly to save lives. Citizens are requested to drive cautiously, especially during night hours and in foggy conditions. Several Good Samaritans helped in the rescue operation before the ambulances arrived.

unnormalised: Updates are being provided every 2 hrs on the hospital's website & social media handles. The AIIMS helpline number, 011-26588500, is available for those seeking information about their relatives. Authorities are coordinating to ensure adequate resources are available to cope with the ongoing emergency.
normalised: Updates are being provided every two hours on the hospital's website and social media handles. The A-I-I-M-S helpline number, zero double one two six five double eight five double zero, is available for those seeking information about their relatives. Authorities are coordinating to ensure adequate resources are available to cope with the ongoing emergency.
